court: HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM PRESENT THE HONOURABLE MR
outcome: IN CC 2374/2016 OF JUDICIAL MAGISTRATE OF FIRST CLASS -II, KOLLAM CRIME NO.1449/2016 OF KOTTIYAM POLICE STATION, KOLLAM PETITIONER/SOLE ACCUSED: SHAJAHAN @ SHAJI, AGED 60 YEARS, S/O. BADHARUDFEN, RESI
full_text: Ta] 2 afte Bs eet 2020/KER/674 IN THE HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM PRESENT THE HONOURABLE MR. JUSTICE P.B.SURESH KUMAR WEDNESDAY, THE O8TH DAY OF JANUARY 2020 / 18TH POUSHA, 1941 Cr1.MC.No.106 OF 2020(C) AGAINST THE ORDER IN CC 2374/2016 OF JUDICIAL MAGISTRATE OF FIRST CLASS -II, KOLLAM CRIME NO.1449/2016 OF KOTTIYAM POLICE STATION, KOLLAM PETITIONER/SOLE ACCUSED: SHAJAHAN @ SHAJI, AGED 60 YEARS, S/O. BADHARUDFEN, RESIDING AT S.R.MANZIL , NEAR M.E.S. SCHOOL, PATTARUMUKKU, THAZHUTHALA VILLAGE, KOLLAM BY ADV. SRI.S.SREEKUMAR (KOLLAM) RESPONDENTS/STATE AND DE-FACTO COMPLAINANT: 1 THE STATE OF KERALA REPRESENTED BY THE PUBLIC PROSECUTOR, HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM-682 031 2 THE STATION HOUSE OFFICER, KOTTIYAM POLICE STATION, KOLLAM DISTRICT, REPRESENTED THE PUBLIC PROSECUTOR, HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM-682 031 3 RASHEEDA BEEVI, AGED 55 YEARS, D/O. SULEKHA BEEVI, RESIDING AT S.R.MANZIL (VADAKKEVILA VEEDU) , VADAKKUMKARA CHERRY, UMAYANALOOR, THAZHUTHALA VILLAGE, KOLLAM- 691 589 R3 BY ADV. S.JAYAKUMAR (PANAMBIL) SRI.SANTHOSH PETER PP THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 08.01.2020, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: Beyeg oo a 2020/KER/674 Crl.M.C. No.106 of 2020 2 Cri.M.C.No.106 of 2020 ORDER This is a proceedings instituted under Section 482 of the Code of Criminal Procedure for quashing Annexure - A2 final report and all further proceedings pursuant thereto now pending as CC No.2374 of 2016 on the files of the Court of the Judicial Magistrate of First Class - Il, Kollam. 2. The petitioner is the sole accused in the said case. The case was one instituted at the instance of the third respondent under Sections 506(i) and 294(b) of the Indian Penal Code and Section 31(1) of the Protection of women from Domestic Violence Act, 2005 3. It is seen that the third respondent had settled her disputes with the petitioner and an affidavit to that effect has been produced as Annexure A3. 4. Heard the learned counsel for the petitioner, the learned Public Prosecutor as also the learned counsel for the third respondent. BEA 2020/KER/674 Crl.M.C. No.106 of 2020 3 5. In the light of the decision of the Apex Court in Gian singh v. State of Punjab, (2012) 10 SCC 303, insofar as the offences alleged against the petitioner are only offences punishable under Sections 506(i) and 294(b) of the Indian Penal Code and Section 31(1) of the Protection of women from Domestic Violence Act, 2005, | am of the view that this is an appropriate case where this court has to invoke the jurisdiction under Section 482 of the Code of Criminal Procedure to quash the proceedings against the petitioner. In the result, the Crl.M.C. is allowed and Annexure-A2 final report and all further proceedings pursuant thereto against the petitioner pending as CC No.2374 of 2016 on the files of the Court of the Judicial Magistrate of First Class - Il, Kollam are quashed. Sd/- P.B.SURESH KUMAR, JUDGE. YKB kerr La Bs eet 2020/KER/674 Crl.M.C. No.106 of 2020 4 APPENDIX PETITIONER'S/S EXHIBITS: ANNEXURE-A1 A TRUE COPY OF THE FIR IN CRIME NO.1449/2016 DATED 05.06.2016 OF THE KOTTIYAM POLICE STATION ANNEXURE-A2 A TRUE COPY OF THE CHARGE/FINAL REPORT ON THE FILE OF THE JUDICIAL FIRST CLASS MAGISTRATE COURT-II, KOLLAM IN C.C.NO.2374 OF 2016 ANNEXURE-A3 A TRUE COPY OF THE AFFIDAVIT DATED 24.12.2019 HAS BEEN SWORN BY THE THIRD RESPONDENT BEFORE THIS HON'BLE COURT RESPONDENT'S/S EXHIBITS: NIL //TRUE COPY// PA TO JUDGE
